DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Acrobatic
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Balance and Jump checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Agile
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Balance and Escape Artist checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Alertness
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Listen and Spot checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Animal Affinity
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Handle Animal and Ride checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Athletic
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Climb and Swim checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Cleave
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: If you deal a creature enough damage to make it drop (typically by reducing it to below 0 hit points or killing it), you get an immediate, extra melee attack against another creature within reach.
You cannot take a 5-foot step before making this extra attack.
The extra attack is with the same weapon and at the same bonus as the attack that dropped the previous creature.
You can use this ability once per round.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Combat Casting
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You get a +4 bonus on Concentration checks made to cast a spell or use a spell-like ability when casting on the defensive or while grappling or pinned.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Combat Expertise
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: When you use the attack action or the full attack action in melee, you can take a penalty of as much as –5 on your attack roll and add the same number (up to +5) to your Armor Class.
This number may not exceed your base attack bonus.
The changes to attack rolls and Armor Class last until your next action.
The penalty to attack rolls and bonus to Armor Class are chosen before you make your attack roll (so you have to decide to use this feat before you know whether your attack hits or misses).

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Combat Reflexes
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: You may make a number of additional attacks of opportunity equal to your Dexterity bonus.
With this feat, you may also make attacks of opportunity while flat-footed.
Normal: A character without this feat can make only one attack of opportunity per round and can’t make attacks of opportunity while flat-footed.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Deceitful
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Disguise and Forgery checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Deft Hands
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Sleight of Hand and Use Rope checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Diligent
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Appraise and Decipher Script checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Dodge
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: During your action, you designate an opponent and receive a +1 dodge bonus to Armor Class against attacks from that opponent.
You can select a new opponent on any action.
Special: A condition that makes you lose your Dexterity bonus to Armor Class (if any) also makes you lose dodge bonuses.
Also, dodge bonuses stack with each other, unlike most other types of bonuses.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Endurance
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: You gain a +4 bonus on the following checks and saves: Swim checks made to resist nonlethal damage, Constitution checks made to continue running, Constitution checks made to avoid nonlethal damage from a forced march, Constitution checks made to hold your breath, Constitution checks made to avoid nonlethal damage from starvation or thirst, Fortitude saves made to avoid nonlethal damage from hot or cold environments, and Fortitude saves made to resist damage from suffocation.
Also, you may sleep in light or medium armor without becoming fatigued.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Eschew Materials
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: You can cast any spell that has a material component costing 1 gp or less without needing that component.
The casting of the spell still provokes attacks of opportunity as normal.
If the spell requires a material component that costs more than 1 gp, you must have the material component on hand to cast the spell, as normal.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Exotic Weapon Proficiency
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: Choose one exotic weapon, such as a bastard sword or whip.
You understand how to use that weapon in combat, and you can attack with it and incur no penalty.
You are proficient with that weapon.
Normal: A character who uses a weapon with which he or she is not proficient takes a –4 penalty on attack rolls.
Special: You can gain this feat multiple times.
Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new exotic weapon.

prerequisites.special: Proficiency with all martial weapons if the weapon is a ranged weapon

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Far Shot
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: When you use a projectile weapon, such as a bow, its range increment is increased by 50% (multiply by 1.5).
When you use a thrown weapon, its range increment is doubled.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Great Cleave
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: As Cleave, except that you have no limit to the number of times you can use it per round.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Great Fortitude
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Fortitude saving throws.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Bull Rush
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: When you perform a bull rush, you do not provoke an attack of opportunity from the defender.
You also gain a +4 bonus on the opposed Strength check you make to push back the defender.
Normal: Characters without this feat provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a bull rush.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Counterspell
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: When counterspelling, you may use a spell of the same school that is one or more spell levels higher than the target spell.
Normal: Without this feat, you may only counter a spell with the same spell, or with a spell specifically designated as a counterspell for the target spell.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Critical
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: When using the weapon you selected, your threat range is doubled.
For example, a longsword usually threatens a critical hit on a roll of 19–20 (two numbers).
If you have Improved Critical (longsword), the threat range becomes 17–20 (four numbers).
Special: You can gain this feat multiple times.
Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.
This effect doesn’t stack with any other effect that expands the threat range of a weapon (such as the keen edge spell).

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Disarm
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when you attempt to disarm an opponent, nor does the opponent get a chance to disarm you.
You also gain a +4 bonus on the opposed attack roll you make to disarm your opponent.
Normal: Without this feat, you provoke an attack of opportunity when you attempt to disarm an opponent.
Also, if you fail the disarm attempt, your opponent gets an opposed attack roll to disarm you.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Feint
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: You can make a Bluff check to feint in combat as a move action.
Normal: Feinting in combat is a standard action.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Grapple
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when you make a touch attack to start a grapple.
You also gain a +4 bonus on all grapple checks.
Normal: Without this feat, you provoke an attack of opportunity when you make a touch attack to start a grapple.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Initiative
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You get a +4 bonus on initiative checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Overrun
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: When you attempt to overrun an opponent, the target may not choose to avoid you.
You also gain a +4 bonus on your Strength check to knock down your opponent.
Normal: Without this feat, the target of an overrun may choose to avoid you or to block you.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Shield Bash
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: When you perform a shield bash, you may still apply the shield’s shield bonus to your AC.
Normal: Without this feat, you lose the shield’s shield bonus to AC when you perform a shield bash.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Sunder
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: When you strike at an object held or carried by an opponent (such as a weapon or shield), you do not provoke an attack of opportunity.
You also gain a +4 bonus on any attack roll made to sunder an opponent’s weapon or shield.
Normal: Without this feat, you provoke an attack of opportunity when you strike at an object held or carried by an opponent.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Trip
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when you attempt to trip an opponent while you are unarmed.
You also gain a +4 bonus on your Strength check to trip your opponent.
If you trip an opponent in melee combat, you immediately get a melee attack against that opponent as if you hadn’t used your attack for the trip attempt.
Normal: Without this feat, you provoke an attack of opportunity when you attempt to trip an opponent while you are unarmed.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Two-Weapon Fighting
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: You get a second attack with your off-hand weapon, albeit at a –5 penalty.
Normal: Without this feat, you can only get a single extra attack with an off-hand weapon.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Unarmed Strike
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: You are considered to be armed even when unarmed—you do not provoke attacks of opportunity from armed opponents when you attack them while unarmed.
However, you still get an attack of opportunity against any opponent who makes an unarmed attack on you.
Normal: Without this feat, you are considered unarmed when attacking with an unarmed strike, and you can only deal nonlethal damage with such an attack.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Investigator
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Gather Information and Search checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Iron Will
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Will saving throws.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Lightning Reflexes
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Reflex saving throws.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Magical Aptitude
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Spellcraft and Use Magic Device checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Manyshot
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: As a standard action, you may fire two arrows at a single opponent within 30 feet.
Both arrows use the same attack roll (with a –4 penalty) to determine success and deal damage normally (but see Special).
Special: For every five points of base attack bonus you have above +6, you may add one additional arrow to this attack, to a maximum of four arrows at a base attack bonus of +16.
Each arrow incurs an additional –2 penalty on the attack roll (for example, three arrows would be at a –6 penalty and four arrows at a –8 penalty).
Damage reduction and other resistances apply separately against each arrow fired.
Regardless of the number of arrows you fire, you apply precision-based damage (such as sneak attack damage) only once.
If you score a critical hit, only the first arrow fired deals critical damage; all others deal regular damage.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Mobility
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: You get a +4 dodge bonus to Armor Class against attacks of opportunity caused when you move out of or within a threatened area.
A condition that makes you lose your Dexterity bonus to Armor Class (if any) also makes you lose dodge bonuses.
Dodge bonuses stack with each other, unlike most other types of bonuses.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Mounted Archery
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: The penalty you take when using a ranged weapon while your mount is taking a double move is halved: –2 instead of –4.
The penalty you take when using a ranged weapon while your mount is running is also halved: –4 instead of –8.
Normal: If your mount is taking a double move, you take a –4 penalty on attack rolls with a ranged weapon.
If your mount is running, you take a –8 penalty.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Mounted Combat
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: Once per round when your mount is hit in combat, you may attempt a Ride check (as a reaction) to negate the hit.
The hit is negated if your Ride check result is greater than the opponent’s attack roll.
(Essentially, the Ride check result becomes the mount’s Armor Class if it’s higher than the mount’s regular AC.)

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Natural Spell
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: You can complete the verbal and somatic components of spells while in a wild shape.
This feat does not permit the use of material components or focuses.
You can use any material components or focuses you can hold or manipulate with your new form’s limbs.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Negotiator
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Diplomacy and Sense Motive checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Nimble Fingers
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Disable Device and Open Lock checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Persuasive
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Bluff and Intimidate checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Point Blank Shot
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You get a +1 bonus on attack and damage rolls with ranged weapons at ranges of up to 30 feet.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Power Attack
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: On your action, before making attack rolls for a round, you may choose to subtract a number from all melee attack rolls and add the same number to all melee damage rolls.
This number may not exceed your base attack bonus.
The penalty on attacks and bonus on damage apply until your next turn.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Precise Shot
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You can shoot or throw ranged weapons at an opponent engaged in melee without taking the standard –4 penalty on your attack roll.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Quick Draw
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: You can draw a weapon as a free action instead of as a move action.
You can draw a hidden weapon (see the Sleight of Hand skill) as a move action.
A character who has selected this feat may throw weapons at his full normal rate of attacks (much like a character with a bow).
Normal: Without this feat, you may draw a weapon as a move action, or (if your base attack bonus is +1 or higher) as a free action as part of movement.
Without this feat, you can draw a hidden weapon as a standard action.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Rapid Reload
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: Choose a type of crossbow (hand, light, or heavy).
Reloading that type of crossbow is a free action (for a hand or light crossbow) or a move action (for a heavy crossbow).
Reloading a crossbow still provokes an attack of opportunity.
If you have selected this feat for hand crossbow or light crossbow, you may fire that weapon as many times in a full attack action as you could if you were using a bow.
Normal: A character without this feat needs a move action to reload a hand or light crossbow, or a full-round action to reload a heavy crossbow.
Special: You can gain this feat multiple times.
Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of crossbow.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Rapid Shot
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: You can get one extra attack per round with a ranged weapon.
The attack is at your highest base attack bonus, but each attack you make in that round (the extra one and the normal ones) takes a –2 penalty.
You must use the full attack action to use this feat.
Normal: A character without this feat can only get a single extra attack with an off-hand weapon.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Ride-By Attack
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: When you are mounted and use the charge action, you may move and attack as if making a standard charge and then move again (continuing the straight line of the charge).
Your total movement for the round can’t exceed double your mounted speed.
You and your mount do not provoke an attack of opportunity from the opponent that you attack.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Run
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: When running, you move five times your normal speed (if wearing light or no armor and carrying no more than a light load) or four times your speed (if wearing medium or heavy armor or carrying a medium or heavy load).
If you make a jump after a running start (see the Jump skill description), you gain a +4 bonus on your Jump check.
While running, you retain your Dexterity bonus to AC.
Normal: You move four times your speed (if wearing light or no armor and carrying no more than a light load) or three times your speed (if wearing medium or heavy armor or carrying a medium or heavy load), and you lose your Dexterity bonus to AC.
If you make a jump after a running start, you gain no bonus on your Jump check.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Scribe Scroll
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: You can create a scroll of any spell that you know.
Scribing a scroll takes one day for each 1,000 gp in its base price.
The base price of a scroll is its spell level × its caster level × 25 gp.
To scribe a scroll, you must spend 1/25 of this base price in XP and use up raw materials costing one-half of this base price.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Self-Sufficient
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Heal and Survival checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Shield Proficiency
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You can use a shield and take only the standard penalties.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Shot on the Run
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: When using the attack action with a ranged weapon, you can move both before and after the attack, provided that your total distance moved is not greater than your speed.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Skill Focus
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: Choose a skill.
You get a +3 bonus on all checks involving that skill.
Special: You can gain this feat multiple times.
Its effects do not stack.
Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new skill.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Spell Focus
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: Choose a school of magic (such as Illusion).
Add +1 to the Difficulty Class for all saving throws against spells from the school of magic you select.
Special: You can gain this feat multiple times.
Its effects do not stack.
Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new school of magic.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Greater Spell Focus
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: Add +1 to the Difficulty Class for all saving throws against spells from the school of magic you select.
This bonus stacks with the bonus from Spell Focus.
Special: You can gain this feat multiple times.
Its effects do not stack.
Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new school of magic to which you already have applied the Spell Focus feat.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Spell Mastery
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: Each time you take this feat, choose a number of spells that you already know equal to your Intelligence modifier.
From that point on, you can prepare these spells without referring to a spellbook.
Normal: Without this feat, you must use a spellbook to prepare all your spells, except read magic.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Spell Penetration
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on caster level checks (1d20 + caster level) made to overcome a creature’s spell resistance.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Greater Spell Penetration
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on caster level checks (1d20 + caster level) made to overcome a creature’s spell resistance.
This bonus stacks with the bonus from Spell Penetration.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Spirited Charge
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: When mounted and using the charge action, you deal double damage with a melee weapon (or triple damage with a lance).

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Spring Attack
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: When using the attack action with a melee weapon, you can move both before and after the attack, provided that your total distance moved is not greater than your speed.
Moving in this way does not provoke an attack of opportunity from the defender you attack (though it may provoke attacks of opportunity from other creatures, if appropriate).
You can’t use this feat if you are carrying a heavy load or wearing heavy armor.
You must move at least 5 feet both before and after you make your attack in order to utilize the benefits of Spring Attack.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Stealthy
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Hide and Move Silently checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Stunning Fist
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: You must declare that you are using this feat before you make your attack roll (thus, a failed attack roll ruins the attempt).
Stunning Fist forces a foe damaged by your unarmed attack to make a Fortitude saving throw (DC 10 + 1/2 your character level + your Wis modifier), in addition to dealing damage normally.
A defender who fails this saving throw is stunned for 1 round (until just before your next action).
A stunned character can’t act, loses any Dexterity bonus to AC, and takes a –2 penalty to AC.
You may attempt a stunning attack once per day for every four levels you have attained (but see Special), and no more than once per round.
Special: A monk may select Stunning Fist as a bonus feat at 1st level, even if she does not meet the prerequisites.
A monk who selects this feat may attempt a stunning attack a number of times per day equal to her monk level, plus one more time per day for every four levels she has in classes other than monk.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Toughness
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: You gain +3 hit points.
Special: A character may gain this feat multiple times.
Its effects stack.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Track
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: To find tracks or to follow them for 1 mile requires a successful Survival check.
You must make another Survival check every time the tracks become difficult to follow.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Trample
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: When you attempt to overrun an opponent while mounted, your target may not choose to avoid you.
Your mount may make one hoof attack against any target you knock down, gaining the standard +4 bonus on attack rolls against prone targets.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Two-Weapon Defense
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: When wielding a double weapon or two weapons (not including natural weapons or unarmed strikes), you gain a +1 shield bonus to your AC.
When you are fighting defensively or using the total defense action, this shield bonus increases to +2.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Two-Weapon Fighting
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: Your penalties on attack rolls for fighting with two weapons are reduced.
The penalty for your primary hand lessens by 2 and the one for your off hand lessens by 6.
Normal: If you wield a second weapon in your off hand, you can get one extra attack per round with that weapon.
When fighting in this way you take a –6 penalty on your regular attack or attacks with your primary hand and a –10 penalty on the attack with your off hand.
If your off-hand weapon is light, the penalties are reduced by 2 each.
(An unarmed strike is always considered light.)

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Weapon Finesse
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: With a light weapon, rapier, whip, or spiked chain made for a creature of your size category, you may use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls.
If you carry a shield, its armor check penalty applies to your attack rolls.
Normal: With a light weapon, you can use your Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier on attack rolls, whichever is higher.
With a one-handed weapon, a two-handed weapon, a ranged weapon other than a sling, or when using a shield, you must use your Strength modifier on attack rolls.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Weapon Focus
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: Choose one type of weapon (such as greataxe).
You can also choose unarmed strike or grapple as your weapon for purposes of this feat.
You gain a +1 bonus on all attack rolls you make using the selected weapon.
Special: You can gain this feat multiple times.
Its effects do not stack.
Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Greater Weapon Focus
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: Choose one type of weapon (such as greataxe) for which you have already selected Weapon Focus.
You gain a +1 bonus on all attack rolls you make using the selected weapon.
This bonus stacks with other bonuses on attack rolls, including the one from Weapon Focus.
Special: You can gain this feat multiple times.
Its effects do not stack.
Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon for which you already have Weapon Focus.
A fighter may select Greater Weapon Focus as one of his fighter bonus feats.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Weapon Specialization
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: Choose one type of weapon (such as greataxe) for which you have already selected Weapon Focus.
You gain a +2 bonus on all damage rolls you make using the selected weapon.
Special: You can gain this feat multiple times.
Its effects do not stack.
Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon for which you already have Weapon Focus.
A fighter may select Weapon Specialization as one of his fighter bonus feats.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Greater Weapon Specialization
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: Choose one type of weapon (such as greataxe) for which you have already selected Weapon Specialization.
You gain a +2 bonus on all damage rolls you make using the selected weapon.
This bonus stacks with other bonuses on damage rolls, including the one from Weapon Specialization.
Special: You can gain this feat multiple times.
Its effects do not stack.
Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon for which you already have Weapon Specialization.
A fighter may select Greater Weapon Specialization as one of his fighter bonus feats.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Whirlwind Attack
DND_FEATS_DATA.description:
Benefit: When you use the full attack action, you can give up your regular attacks and instead make one melee attack at your full base attack bonus against each opponent within reach.
You must make a separate attack roll against each opponent.
When you use the Whirlwind Attack feat, you also forfeit any bonus or extra attacks granted by other feats or abilities (such as Cleave or the haste spell).
